intro: Quercus oidocarpa, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. Its acorns are small and typically have a scaly cap, which is a distinguishing feature. Quercus oidocarpa plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various wildlife species.
